Fishing: Fishing rod(s) or fly fishing rod(s)

Horse-riding: Shirt (breathable fabric that doesnt restrict your movement)
Boots (tall boots or short paddock boots)

Cherry Blossom Viewing: A book or something to entertain you
Picnic: Picnic blanket (preferably waterproof on the bottom)
Picnic chairs (if anyone in your group is not happy on the ground)
Skiing/Snowboarding: Driving licence/GPS navigation device/directions if you're driving
Fishing: Lures (spoons, hard baits, soft baits, tubes, crankbaits, spinnerbaits, search baits, etc.)

Swimming: Hat, towel, sunglasses, sunblock and book
Picnic: Portable picnic table (if that's the kind of picnic you're having!)
Skiing/Snowboarding: Ski Club membership card (for member discounts in resort)
Fully charged mobile phone, charger and external battery

Camping: Lantern (and mantles and fuel/batteries if needed)

Hiking/Trekking: Boots or shoes suited to terrain

Rock Climbing: Tape or rappel gloves (used to protect hands)

River Rafting: Satellite phone (consider for safety if no service)
Canoeing: Emergency floating throw line (with throw bag)

Picnic: Cutting board (also useful as a level serving surface, perfect for drinks)
Skiing/Snowboarding: Transceiver, shovel and probe (for staying safe off piste)

Picnic: Sharp knife (even if you don't plan to cut things, it's still a good idea)

Skiing/Snowboarding: Multitool for repairs or adjustments on the go

Picnic: Mustard, mayo, ketchup, etc., if needed (a great way to make use of extra packets from a takeout place)

Rock Climbing: Snack (gels, energy bars, trail mix, granola bar, etc.)
Canoeing: Maps and charts in waterproof case

Hiking/Trekking: Gaiters (for rainy, snowy or muddy conditions)

River Rafting: Otter box or Ammo can (waterproof) for phone/keys
Picnic: A couple of dishtowels (always handy, and useful to buffer and support dishes in transport)
Extra plastic containers or sturdy zipper-top bags for packing up dirty utensils, leftovers, etc.

River Rafting: Toilet system (washable, leak-proof), TP, hand santizer
Camping: Mallet or hammer (for hammering tent stakes)

Rock Climbing: Down or fleece jacket for insulation

River Rafting: Rafts, frames, oars (bring one spare per raft), pump, repair kit
Rock Climbing: Hiking shoes or sandals - something to change into while belaying

Fishing: Map of the fishing territory including forested paths and waterways

Picnic: Flashlight (if you plan to be out into the evening hours)
Mountaineering: 20 ft. of 5-7mm accessory cords (to make prusik slings)

Picnic: Sport or activity equipment (Frisbees, balls, bubbles, water guns ... whatever the crowd likes)

Mountaineering: Satellite messenger and/or personal locator beacon
Battery pack or a solar panel for charging phone and/or GPS

Hiking/Trekking: Two itineraries: 1 left with friend + 1 under car seat

River Rafting: 50 Gal water (based on .75 gal per person per day)
Fishing: Cap or hat with mosquito net
Mountaineering: Sleeping pads (1 foam + 1 inflatable to deal with severe cold)

River Rafting: Food (ideally prepared) for at least one more day than you need
Snacks for on river (dont forget the jerky)

Fishing: Personal floatation device (PFD) with multiple pockets

River Rafting: Backpacking pots and pans, kettle, hot pads
Fishing: Nautical safety kit (whistle, rope, scoop, etc.)

Cycling: Cycling layers  windbreaker, rain jacket, sleeves, leggings, etc. (weather dependent)
Bike shorts (with small tube of chamois cream)
Canoeing: Credit card; small amount of cash
Trip itinerary left with friend + under car seat

River Rafting: Dishwashing tubs and washing supplies (soap and bleach)
Skiing/Snowboarding: High energy snacks  chocolate bars/energy bars/nuts

Camping: Large, clear plastic bins to store kitchen gear

Cycling: Post-ride set of clothes - shirt, shorts/pants, underwear, socks, etc.

Mountaineering: Energy food and drinks (bars, gels, chews, trail mix, drink mix)

Hiking/Trekking: Small gear-repair kit (duct tape, zip ties, etc)

Mountaineering: Pack extra dry clothes * beyond those required for the trip.

Cycling: Photocopies of passport and credit cards

Camping: Dry bags, stuff sacks or clear plastic bins to store items

Canoeing: Spray jacket or rainwear (jacket and pants)

Mountaineering: Insulated/down or synthetic booties for camp wear

Camping: Boots or shoes suited to terrain

Mountaineering: Gaiters (for rainy, snowy or muddy conditions
Two itineraries: 1 left with friend + 1 under car seat

Camping: First-aid kit or first-aid supplies (see First-Aid Checklist)
Mountaineering: Toilet paper and sealable bag (to pack it out)
Sunglasses + sunglasses straps and/or goggles (better for high winds)
Nose guard (strip of fabric that covers the top of the nose)
